org.instantplaces.purewidgets.server
Class RemoteStorage

java.lang.Object
  org.instantplaces.purewidgets.server.RemoteStorage

public class RemoteStorage
extends java.lang.Object

The RemoteStorage is a helper class for storing the application's widgets and name/value pairs on the serverstore.

Author:
Jorge C. S. Cardoso

Field Detail

key

private com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Key key
The key for the object on the datastore. The class doesn't use this but the datastore does.

keys

private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> keys
Since the datastore can't store Hashmaps, we need to implement our own hashmap like structure. The 'keys' variable holds the names of the name/value pair.

values

private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values
Since the datastore can't store Hashmaps, we need to implement our own hashmap like structure. The 'values' variable holds the values of the name/value pair.

widgetKeys

private java.util.ArrayList<com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Key> widgetKeys
Widgets have an inheritance structure that the datastore does not support so we need to manually manage the stored widgets by keeping references for their keys.

widgetClasses

private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> widgetClasses
Unfortunately there's not way to ask the datastore for an object without specifying its class, so in addition to the object key, we need to store its class.

initialWidgetList

private java.util.ArrayList<Widget> initialWidgetList
For each session, the widgets are loaded in the beginning and saved in the end. This variable keeps the original loaded widgets so that, in the end, we can compare them to the current set and delete the ones that were deleted by the application and add the ones that were added by the application.

Constructor Detail

RemoteStorage

public RemoteStorage()
Creates and empty RemoteStorage object.

Method Detail

loadWidgets

public java.util.ArrayList<Widget> loadWidgets(ApplicationLifeCycle app,
                                               javax.jdo.PersistenceManager pm)
Loads the widgets for this application by traversing the current list of keys and classes and manually loading the objects. Because the widgets need an ActionListener, which we don't store, this method requires an ApplicationLifeCycle object (which extends ActionListener), so that it can add the ActionListener to each loaded widget.

Parameters:
app - The ApplicationLifeCycle object that will listen for events from the widgets.
pm - The PersistenceManager object used to access the datastore.
Returns:
The loaded widget list.

saveWidgets

public void saveWidgets(java.util.ArrayList<Widget> widgets,
                        javax.jdo.PersistenceManager pm)
Saves a list of widgets to the DS. This method will check if there are widgets which are in the RemoteStorage's initialWidgetList but not in the received widget list. If there are, these widgets will be deleted from the DS.

Parameters:
widgets - The widget list to save to the DS.
pm - The PersistenceManager object to access the DS.

deleteUnusedFromStore

private void deleteUnusedFromStore(java.util.ArrayList<Widget> widgets,
                                   javax.jdo.PersistenceManager pm)
Given the current list of widgets, this method will check the initial widget list and delete from the DS widgets which are no longer in the widget list.

Parameters:
widgets - The current widget list.
pm - The PersistenceManager object to access the DS.

setString

public void setString(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String value)
Saves a name/value pair in the DS. If the name already exists, its value will be replaced by the new one. If not, a new pair is created.

Parameters:
name - The name to store.
value - The value to store.

getString

public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String name)
Retrieves a value from the DS, given its name.

Parameters:
name - The name of the value to retrieve.
Returns:
The value associated with the name, or null if the name does not exist.

setLong

public void setLong(java.lang.String name,
                    long value)

getLong

public long getLong(java.lang.String name)
